text: Cosipara flexuosa is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Harrison Gray Dyar Jr. in 1918. It is found in Chiapas, Mexico. The wingspan is about 24 mm. Adults have been recorded on wing in May.Proceedings of the United States National Museum 54 (2239): 370 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1918 Category:Scopariinae
title: Cosipara flexuosa
